abstract.p: Jane Morris letter says that if Mayor Rudolph Giuliani's wife really cares for him she should realize how important it is for cancer patient to have as little stress in his life as possible

block.p: Re ''Giuliani and His Wife of 16 Years Are Separating'' (front page, May 11): If Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani's wife, Donna Hanover, truly cares for him, she should realize how important it is for a cancer patient to have as little stress in his life as possible. No matter how hurt she may be, that can be dealt with later. Winning a battle with cancer requires as much peace as possible. That's a tall order for any politician, let alone a mayor of New York City who is also running a Senate campaign.
JANE MORRIS El Cajon, Calif., May 11, 2000
